caption: Absolutely FANTASTIC museum for kids and families !  We went to see the En avant la musique exhibition, and it was brilliant!  Child friendly, there was a treasure hunt game given to the kids, the staff explained the rules directly to kids, blown away by how professional everyone was, how beautiful the exhibition was!  The kids were able to touch tape from casettes, CDs, just great!  Tips: Buy tickets on the website in advance.  Parking: There is an Indigo parking Louvre Samaritaine right next to the museum if you are coming by car.
The museum is more suitable for very young children, around 4 years old, but not beyond that. It might feel a bit boring for older kids or adults

Murakami and Japanese monsters and creatures just ended and it was awesome. The museum is quite small but very adapted for children. Many different things to see, explain and talk about. They always propose creative workshops for differents ages. My children of 4 and 7 loved it.

This museum is a little hidden gem in Paris. Every local parent reccomended it at school so we went there. The kids loved it and engaged with all the games to completion. The star artist was speedy graphito - he is excellent ! All the kids had fun learning about Art. I want to thank the museum for the available guides, the gifts and the booklets. Everyone loved it! and please add more english signs ;)
Not worth it. The place is tiny and I‚Äôm not sure how kids would find this place that interesting. It‚Äôs only ‚Ç¨6 per person so not a huge expense but we spent like 5 mins in there.
Great interactive museum for kids
A lovely small museum with a nice exhibition of Chinese artist Wenna this time. The entree price of ‚Ç¨8 is affordable and there are activities for kids in every room.
Small but very nice place,  for 5 years old it took 2h to visit. They loved doing the exercises from each room,  in the little book they received with magic penüôÇ
Not so entertaining, there was nobody inside to guide or entertain the baby. The games require some interaction and an adult would be good to improve the experience

Small museum with changing exhibits. Staff was very friendly, some activities for the kids, but a bit too small. No special pricing for kids, everyone pays the same. End to end visit will take less than 1 hour.
Went when there was a Murakami exhibit. Overall, quite small an be not with the cost in opinion. It wasn't the first time seeing his works for me though.

Great art museum geared towards kids‚Äînot to be confused with a ‚Äúchildren‚Äôs museum,‚Äù this is an actual museum that exists to help kids learn about art and museum visits. I visited the L‚ÄôAtlas exhibit with my 6 year old daughter and got an activity book (heads up‚Äîthey only have it in French) that she filled out during our visit and got a little surprise at the end. There are also ‚Äúactivit√©s anim√©es‚Äù that you can sign your child up for in advance if that is more your style, and again if you/your child understand French. Really it‚Äôs amazing to see how well-behaved kids can be in a museum setting! The staff is helpful (I speak passable French but got a little orientation from a staff member at the beginning of our visit in English) and very available throughout the museum if you have questions. I don‚Äôt think that the museum is all that expensive, per other reviewers‚Äô notes (6‚Ç¨/person), we spent an hour there but I could see very young children speeding through if you didn‚Äôt stop and discuss what you are seeing in each room. Would definitely recommend for kids ages 3+!
Cute little children's museum! Wasn't too long which is what you'd want with anyone under 10 but interactive enough to keep my son's interest until the end, Petit mus√©e pour les enfants tr√®s sympa!

Great place for children. Ours aged 3 and 6 were both engaged in the art and activity booklet. The whole museum at the moment is exhibiting the Play with Seth exhibition over its 3 rooms. It's advisable to book but we didn't and were let in.  We went here after discovering Centre Pompidou was shut due to strike action.  There was space to park our buggy squeezed in with others.  As it's a children's place it was relaxing as the lighting was low and it was OK to sit on the floor and play the games or do the activities.  Staff very helpful and several spoke English. There's an English translation booklet of the exhibition and English versions of the children's activities both for the young and older child.  A lovely touch to gift a little gift at the end. And other fun things but I won't spoil the surprises!! Enjoy your visit :)

Sure, it's pretty beautiful but also very tiny and even though they have a small 'quest' it's not really a place to entertain kids as claimed. 20 min and you're through, and it's art, so no touch.. :|
Short but sweet. Cool artwork and with the ¬´¬†find the hidden figures¬†¬ª booklet its a fun experience for kids!
Very good experience. Good for young kids, adults as well ‚ò∫Ô∏è! 7eur fee.

About $10 per person including children. Really small, like 2000square feet/200sq meters small. Can walk through in a few minutes. Unless it's raining and you have very small kids, skippable place for sure.
Small but good for kids with calm activities, like puzzle. Ticket price is not expensive
Interesting little museum, no need to pre book. A little too babyish for 9+.
If you don't have (young) kids anymore at home, gives you back the urge and magic to be one again.
Great! Invader has been extended, bring the family and enjoy his genius

They had an exhibition of recorded music from earliest records through to modern digital music. Fantastic, we were there for hours even though it's not big. The children had a great time with the bits they could play with.

Visited to see the Seth Globalpainter exhibition which was brilliantly present as both an exhibition and a children's scavenger hunt to learn more about the art as well as engage them more about the art. Gift shop had some really interesting items and staff very friendly and helpful.
This is super fun for kids.  Mine are 10, 7, and 3 and enjoyed it.  Cool if you like street art and have kids. Just note they need your help for the main activity if they are young.

Unique kid‚Äôs museum. my 15 month old loved running around and playing with the exhibits and my husband and I enjoyed the art and the ‚Äúextra challenge‚Äù. I highly recommend going in the morning when It isn‚Äôt too crowded.
Great place for kids would love to get the contact info of the artist
Such a great space to introduce art to kids, took our 10 and 13 year olds and they had a great time. It's a small museum so not too long or overwhelming for children.
ateliers were excellent for kids - french speakin only
Fabulous and Fun for a family time in Paris.
Cat‚Äôs exhibition was weird and not for kids. We were done in 10 minutes.
Went here with a 3 year old, interactive child based museum,  great atelier also diwn stairs for younger children.

We love this museum. Went last year for the Geluck exhibit and this year they had an exhibit on Invaders, french artist hiding mosaics throughout cities around the world. Made for a fun after-visit treasure hunt through the streets of Paris.
It's a very nice place to go with small kid. It's a one of a kind in Paris, where museums usually don't have activities for kids before they're 5 or 6 years old.

I don't see how this is catered to kids. We did a guided tour, and there was zero interaction with the art: just watching, apart from a couple of games in a corner. What's the difference with a normal museums? Besides, the exhibit was "street art", and they chose to show the artist Atlas: black and white drawings with straight lines. Not the most alluring artist for kids.
A bit small, but they have Miyazaki on display which saved the fun of our visit. They arrange events for kids which was fun for my son.

Total waste of time and money Just don‚Äôt get how this place qualifies as a museum instead of a sauna. There‚Äôs some sort of interactive quiz that can be done in 20 minutes. At the end of our visit I was gasping for air and felt suffocated as the temperature inside is 35 degrees Celsius with no window or air conditioning. They don‚Äôt have a cloakroom. Just don‚Äôt go
Greatly enjoyed the exposition on the artist "invader" but I found the place too "childish" and didn't take very long go to visit. Count 15 mins minimum
